alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area; South Washington Cascade Foothills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 02 at 6:19PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Much of southwest Washington and northwest Oregon, but not the high Cascades or the Hood River Valley. * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Warm front lifting north tonight will bring increasing rain this evening, spreading from south to north across the region. Rain will be heavy at times tonight and Sunday, then again Monday and Tuesday. Additional rain amounts expected tonight through Sunday afternoon: 1 to 3 inches along the south Washington and north Oregon coast, 2 to 4 inches along the central Oregon coast, 2 to 5 inches over the Coast Range and Willapa Hills (with 3 to 7 inches in Oregon Coast Range), 1 to 3 inches across the interior lowlands of southwest Washington and northwest Oregon (highest to south of Portland), 3 to 6 inches across the Cascades, with 1 to 3 inches in the inner Columbia Gorge and Hood River Valley. More rain is expected Monday and Tuesday with another frontal system, though heaviest rain will likely remain over western Washington. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; South Washington Cascade Foothills
